result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy James St Clair

records.addlTxt:
AND BAIL/BOND HEARING 9:00 AM Defendant Billy James St Clair in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Billy James St Clair.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hoffman asks for status conference. Court sets status conference. Attorney Hoffman asks for bail modification. Defendant is unable to post cash ordered. Notes that the DOC hold has been lifted. Defendant could post $2,500 cash bail and reviews that past charges at initial appearance was not accurate information as defendant states he has not been charged with heroin. State is opposed to bail modification. Defendant is on extended supervision. State notes pending Ashland County charges and defendant was out on bail when this incident occurred. Defendant makes a statement to the Court. Court reviews prior charges and purpose of bail. Court denies bail modification.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant Billy James St Clair in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Billy James St Clair.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing as freely and voluntarily waived. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings. Court sets arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:51 PM Defendant Billy James St Clair appeared by video, in custody appearing with Attorney Michael Hoffman.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint. 723 5th Ave E in Ashland WI. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requesting $5000 cb No contact with AD or 3343 S. Cty Rd O in Brule
State reviews criminal history and prior failures to appear.  Pending felony case. Has multiple prior convictions, is on supervision currently. Prior extended supervision revoked
Attorney Hoffman makes argument; prior to ashland address which he's resided at for 2 years was a maple resident.  limited means to post- $100cb.
Defendant makes statement to the court that he does not have any felony charges pending.
Court orders $5000cb; multiple concerns. Extremely serious history, on bond, on supervision.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
